thread.title: Roswell police offer station as 'safe zone' for online sales
thread.title_full: Roswell police offer station as 'safe zone' for online sales

author: The Associated Press
title: Roswell police offer station as 'safe zone' for online sales
text:
Roswell police offer station as 'safe zone' for online sales The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story ROSWELL, N.M. 
The Roswell Police Department is offering its headquarters as a safe place for people buying and selling things online to meet. 
The Roswell Daily Record reports (http://bit.ly/1M8782l) that police are opening up the parking lot and lobby of their headquarters as a "Safe Zone" for completing transactions initiated on Craigslist or elsewhere online. 
Authorities say they are not going to get involved in the business of a sale. They also are not guaranteeing the quality or authenticity of an item. 
Police say they want to have a site where people can be safe when completing online purchases. 
They say the lobby and parking lot are under 24-hour camera surveillance and officers are usually nearby. 
Police departments nationwide have set up "safe zones" to decrease violence related to online purchases. Related content
